channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.description: A 39-year-old woman in Parma, Ohio was sentenced to two months working in a fast-food restaurant after throwing a hot bowl in a Chipotle worker‚Äôs face.

item.title: CVS slashes profit outlook on higher medical costs, says top Aetna executive will leave
item.description: CVS said higher medical costs are weighing on its insurance business, and announced Aetna President Brian Kane will step down.

item.title: Dow futures jump for a second day, up 200 points as Wall Street tries to recoup sell-off: Live updates
item.description: Stock futures popped after Wall Street snapped a three-day losing streak. Investors also looked to claw back more of the losses suffered earlier in the week.

item.title: Markets are counting on the Fed to head off recession with sizable interest rate cuts
item.description: How Chair Jerome Powell and his cohorts react likely will go a long way in determining how investors negotiate a turbulent climate.

item.title: Russia hates on the Olympic Games, relishing 'scandals' and controversy in Paris
item.description: Russia's media has shunned coverage of the Olympic Games in Paris ‚Äî unless something has been controversial or gone wrong.

item.title: CVS‚Äôs stock drops as the healthcare-benefits business continues to hurt profits
item.description: CVS‚Äôs CEO said the company is ‚Äútaking action‚Äù to address its challenges, including making leadership changes in some business segments.

item.title: Weekly mortgage refinance demand soars 16% as rates sink to lowest level in over a year
item.description: Mortgage interest rates dropped last week to the lowest level since May 2023, causing a surge in mortgage demand from both homebuyers and especially current homeowners.

item.title: Elon Musk 'accountable to no one,' Britain's tech minister says after X owner's comments on UK riots
item.description: Elon Musk can't be held to account by anyone, the U.K.'s technology minister said, adding to criticisms of the billionaire from government officials.

item.title: Warner Music‚Äôs stock rises after profit matches estimates despite small revenue miss
item.description: Warner Music Group Corp.‚Äôs stock rose 3% premarket Wednesday, after the company matched profit estimates for the second quarter, offsetting a small revenue miss.

item.title: Treasury yields tick higher as global stocks continue rebound
item.description: Treasury yields were higher early Wednesday as global markets reversed course from Monday's equity sell-off.

item.title: Markets are counting on the Fed to head off recession with sizable interest rate cuts
item.description: How Chair Jerome Powell and his cohorts react likely will go a long way in determining how investors negotiate a turbulent climate.

item.title: New York Times says new digital-only subscribers helped profit rise 41%
item.description: News-media provider added 300,000 digital-only subscribers, bringing the number to a total of 10.84 million

item.title: Harris and Walz make Trump focus at Democratic ticket's first rally
item.description: Kamala Harris and Tim Walz are up against the Republican ticket of Donald Trump and Sen. JD Vance.

item.title: Disney beats estimates as combined streaming services turn a profit
item.description: Disney beat estimates as its combined streaming businesses ‚Äî Disney+, Hulu and ESPN+ ‚Äî turned a profit for the first time.
